subject: Re: [junit] Re: Running JUnit tests against a .jar file
msgSnippet: Are you sure the path to your jar is correct? jar path FiletoRunTestAgainst.jar Have your class in your jar file do something, anything.
messageBody:
Are you sure the path to your jar is correct?
"jar\path\FiletoRunTestAgainst.jar"

Have your class in your jar file do something, anything.



On 8/30/07, sdny_mo <sdny_mo@...> wrote:
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "David Saff" <saff@...> wrote:
> >
> > sdny,
> >
> > What you have so far appears reasonable on first glance. Can you use
> > a similar classpath to run a "main" method from your jar?
> >
> > David Saff
> >
>
> I don't know how to do that, currently my code does nothing...the .jar
> file isnt loaded so i get a bunch of "package ***** does not exist"
> and "cannot find symbol" errors when my tests compile.
>
> i'm using ant version 1.6.5 if that makes any difference.
>
> Thanks.
>
>
